Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code R 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
1

youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth refused to enter his room for reflection time on 01/22/2025
and a staff member used physical management to escort the
youth to his room.
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed 02/12/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention Facility. Youth A stated he refused to step into his room
for shift change and said, “I’m not going to my room” to Staff 1.
Youth A stated Staff 1 laughed, went behind him, wrapped his
arms around him, moved him into room 3 and closed the door.
Youth A stated he was not injured in this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 02/12/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention Facility. Staff 1 stated Youth A clenched his fists and
told him that he was not stepping into his room. Staff 1 stated he
verbally redirected Youth A several times and then placed Youth A
in a primary restraint technique hold and escorted him to his room
and closed the door.
Video
01/22/2025 Unit 1C video footage was reviewed. It shows at
2:27:40 PM youths start entering their rooms and Youth A is the
only youth not in his room around 2:30 PM. Staff 1 uses his radio
after a failed primary restraint technique hold of Youth A at
2:32:25 PM. Youth A stands at the unit door and pushes the
intercom button. Staff 1 and Youth A talk. Staff 1 secures Youth A
in a primary restraint technique hold at 2:34:58 PM and walks
Youth A to his room. Youth A’s room door is closed at 2:35:11 PM.
Youth A exits his room at 2:57:38 PM and sees a nurse on the
unit.
Documentation
Staff 1 wrote an incident report and restraint report dated
01/22/2025 that coincides with his interview. The restraint report
states the physical management lasted 10 seconds.
Staff 1’s physical management of Youth A was entered into
MiSACWIS by Manager 1. Manager 1 wrote Youth A’s physical
management was not warranted.
Tour
2

Unit 1C has a capacity for 6 youths. One steps into the common
area upon entering the unit. The common area has tables with
attached stool seating, couches and a television. Each youth has
their own bedroom that line the common area. Showers are also
located on the unit.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 physically
managed Youth A to his room on 01/22/2025 when he was not a
threat to himself or others.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion
Title plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Rule Code & R 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities;
Section seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Description (5) Staff may not use seclusion for discipline, punishment,
administrative convenience, retaliation, staffing shortages, or
reasons other than a temporary response to behavior that
threatens immediate harm to a youth or others.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Staff 1 was interviewed on 02/12/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention Facility. Staff 1 stated youths are placed in their rooms
with the door closed and locked during shift change, which is
approximately 10 to 15 minutes and then for reflection time.
Video
01/22/2025 Unit 1C video footage was reviewed. It shows at
2:27:40 PM youths start entering their rooms. The last youth,
minus Youth A, enters their room at 2:30:29 PM. Staff 1 places
Youth A in his room around 2:35 PM and closes Youth A’s room
door. Youth A exits his room at 2:57:38 PM and sees a nurse. At
3:46:30 PM all Unit 1C youths (six youths total) are out of their
rooms and in the common area.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Unit 1C weekday daily
schedule states youth reflection and shift change are from 2:40
PM to 3:15 PM.
3

Wayne County Juvenile Detention requested a variance to use
seclusion when a youth becomes an imminent danger to self or
others and de-escalation techniques have failed. This variance
was approved by Division of Child Welfare Licensing Director. The
initial seclusion variance was requested on 08/26/2024 and
approved with a 10/26/2024 expiration date. A second seclusion
variance was requested on 10/23/2024 and approved with a
12/23/2024 expiration date. A third seclusion variance was
requested on 12/20/2024 and approved with a 02/20/2025
expiration date. A fourth seclusion variance was requested on
02/21/2025 and approved with a 04/21/2025 expiration date.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for secluding Unit 1C
youths in their rooms for youth reflection and shift change on
01/22/2025. This is outside the parameters of their approved
variance.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Youths may remain in their rooms with their doors opened or
unlocked for reflection time and shift change.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
